description: INDEX.md hippocampal indexing degradation test at 288 lessons vs projected 500
hypothesis: INDEX.md retrieval quality degrades as lesson count grows beyond the theme bucket maintenance cadence

scale_projections_500L.note: Frozen index loses 30 percentage points of coverage; proportional needs constant manual update

degradation_signals.coverage_gap_now: 81 lessons (28.1%) uncounted in theme index — theme counts are stale
degradation_signals.bucket_diffusion: Meta (58) and Evolution (55) already too large for targeted retrieval; at 500L these become 101 and 95
degradation_signals.next_hit_rate: Only 15.79% of For-next-session items get marked DONE — low recall on coordination signals
degradation_signals.orient_latency: 8.4s at 288L (mostly WSL I/O); will slow but not critically at 500L

verdict_notes: INDEX.md is already degraded (28% uncovered). Graceful degradation only holds if theme buckets are maintained. Without maintenance, coverage falls to 41% at 500L. The hippocampal analogy holds: false retrieval (searching Meta/Evolution finds wrong lessons) increases with bucket size. Key signal: NEXT.md hit rate (15.79%) shows coordination pointers already have low pickup rate.
remediation: Add domain shards to INDEX.md themes (domains/ sections now carry their own indexes)
Add 'new lessons since last INDEX update' counter to orient.py output
Cap theme bucket size at 40 lessons; split buckets when exceeded
measure_orient_latency as a periodic (every 20 sessions) to track I/O degradation
